questions.question: Scenario: A bar chart shows sales of 50, 60, and 80 units over 3 months. What is the percentage increase from month 1 to month 2?
What does a pie chart represent?
Scenario: A table shows 4 students’ scores: 70, 80, 90, 60. What is their average score?
A line graph shows temperatures: 20°C, 25°C, 22°C over 3 days. What is the trend from day 1 to day 2?
Scenario: A pie chart shows expenses: Rent 40%, Food 30%, Travel 20%, Other 10%. If total expense is $500, how much is spent on Food?
What is the average of 10, 20, 30?
Scenario: A bar chart shows profits: $200, $250, $300. What is the percentage increase from the first to the third value?
Analyze: A table shows sales: 100 (Jan), 120 (Feb), 110 (Mar). Which month had the highest growth from the previous month?
What does a line graph typically show?
Scenario: A pie chart shows 25% of a budget is $50. What is the total budget?
A table lists 5 values: 2, 4, 6, 8, 10. What is the median?
Scenario: A bar chart shows 3 years’ revenue: $500, $600, $550. What is the percentage decrease from year 2 to year 3?
Analyze: A line graph shows sales dropping from 50 to 40 to 30. What is the overall trend?
Scenario: A table shows 4 days’ rainfall: 10mm, 15mm, 5mm, 20mm. What is the average rainfall?
A pie chart shows 60% of a total is 120. What is the total?
Scenario: A bar chart shows 3 categories: A (50), B (70), C (30). What percentage does B contribute?
What is the mode of the data: 3, 5, 3, 7, 5?
Analyze: A table shows production: 200 (Q1), 250 (Q2), 230 (Q3). Which quarter had the largest drop?
Scenario: A line graph shows prices: $10, $12, $15 over 3 months. What is the total increase?
A pie chart shows 20% of 300 items are defective. How many are defective?
